skills.name: HTML
skills.description: Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) is the standard markup language for creating web pages and web applications. With Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) and JavaScript it forms a triad of cornerstone technologies for the World Wide Web.

skills.name: CSS
skills.description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language.

skills.name: JS
skills.description: JavaScript is a high-level, dynamic, untyped, and interpreted programming language. It has been standardized in the ECMAScript language specification.

skills.name: JQUERY
skills.description: jQuery is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library. It makes things like HTML document traversal and manipulation, event handling, animation, and Ajax much simpler with an easy-to-use API that works across a multitude of browsers.

skills.name: AJAX
skills.description: short for asynchronous JavaScript and XML) is a set of Web development techniques using many Web technologies on the client side to create asynchronous Web applications.

skills.name: API
skills.description: a set of functions and procedures that allow the creation of applications which access the features or data of an operating system, application, or other service.

skills.name: RUBY
skills.description: Ruby is a programming language from Japan (available at ruby-lang.org) which is revolutionizing the web. The beauty of Ruby is found in its balance between simplicity and power.
